meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of centralism.
meanings.sent1: The centralistic government made decisions for the entire country.
meanings.sent2: Her centralistic views favored a strong central government.
meanings.sent3: The centralistic approach to planning the party made everyone feel included.
meanings.sent4: His centralistic leadership style brought unity to the team.
meanings.sent5: The centralistic nature of the organization ensured efficient communication.

meanings.sent1: The centralistic group campaigned for more power to be given to the central government.

meanings.sent3: The centralistic activists held a peaceful protest for centralized decision-making.

meanings.definition: Tending to concentrate power or control in a central authority.
meanings.sent1: The centralistic policies aimed to strengthen the authority of the central government.
meanings.sent2: Their centralistic tendencies led to a more unified system of governance.
meanings.sent3: The centralistic boss always made sure to oversee all projects closely.
meanings.sent4: The centralistic structure of the organization streamlined decision-making processes.
meanings.sent5: The centralistic control ensured consistency across all branches.
